Text: So let me ask something. I've never tried to download a FLAC ripped from vinyl. Can I tell that I'm listening to a vinyl record?

@natjo
Not exactly like a vinyl. 24Bit/96KHz vinyl rips try to sound like a vinyl but most of them don't. Some of them manage in approaching vinyl warmth and precision, but still nothing sounds like a vinyl except... a vinyl.

^^^ There is no substitute for listening to good vinyl directly from the source.  I think though that people associate "good" vinyl rips and bit length/sampling rate.  Just because an album was ripped to 24bit 96khz doesn't repair any issues the equipment/set up may have.  It's all about the source.  Here I have no idea what equipment was used.
how can you have a vinyl of this already when the album hasn't even been released yet?.
How can you have a vinyl of this album when it hasn't even been released yet?
^^^ ummm I'm curious as to why you even care what I say?  I don't, "put my two cents in" on every vinyl upload.... take it easy and stop being so sensitive.

DAMN what a different sound, they've really changed..
Is it possible to play in itunes and upload to ipod or do i have to convert the format?
THANKS to uploader and FUCk all haters! quality is fine plus its FREE
Thank you! Fantastic dynamic range on this vinyl version! It's a pity the CD or iTunes versions don't have the same DR...
incredible vinyl rip. If you did this yourself: congratulations and thank you :)
What an outstanding torrent. Thank you so much! I've been waiting for this release for ages now. And to @tightbutthole yes you have to convert it to listen to it in itunes and upload it to an ipod.
